Card_1.description: Your friends are planning the trip of a lifetime before all of you get settled into more domestic lives. The plan is to spend a month in Europe, from the verdant forests of Switzerland to the romantic gondolas of Venice, with a grand finale in posh Paris.

Card_2.description: The limited edition crocery set you always dreamt of has just come on the market, and it costs an arm and a leg, as it should. You don't have the money right now, but can save for a few months to get there. Your brand new house deserves the lovely crocery!

Card_3.description: Your parents just bought a new TV and have offered to sell their old one to you for peanuts. On the other hand, you've always wanted the new smart TV on the market, which has great picture and sound quality, and lasts for years son end,  but to buy which you will have to take out a loan.

Card_4.description: It is important to compare the upfront payment as well the recurring costs, when deciding between two options. Sometimes, the cheaper option in the short term can lead to much more money being spent in the long run!

Card_5.description: Your financial planner has advised you to put aside at least a $1000 to cover medical emergencies. You can pay $50 for 20 months, or $100 for just 9!

Card_6.description: An emergency medical situation has led to your parents are facing a financial crunch. They've asked for a little help for a few months to tide them over.

Card_7.description: Family matters can sometimes force us to spend more than we budgeted for and more than we can even afford. It is good to have some slush funds kept aside for such situations, to avoid awkward social situations.

Card_8.description: Your old school has just offered you a position as a substitute warden for the children's Disneyland trip. It clashes with your plans of visiting Africa, which has been a lifelong dream, but at least you get an amazing vacation at a huge discount. The only con is that you will have to be the reponsible adult looking after 20 teenagers there.
Card_8.option_2: Save for the trip $100/month for 6 months

Card_9.description: Sometimes you can find cheaper ways of achieving what you want, with certain very tiny sacrifices. It is up to you to decide if those sacrifices are worth the extra money to you or not.

Card_10.description: Having a healthy amount of savings can help you in more ways than one. For instance, you can then take advantage of excellent investment opportunities like this one. Money begets money!

Card_11.description: Given the amount you drive your new car, it is a miracle that your tires aren't bald yet from all the friction. Irrespective, it is high time you get them changed before you cause an accident. You can get the basic replacement, which is free with your maintenance contract, or you can splurge for the more expensive ones, which last twice as long.

Card_12.description: Having a slush fund also helps in buying more expensive things, but which are higher in quality and last longer, leading to savings in the long run.

Card_13.description: A mutual fund lets you invest in the stock market without having to research individual companies. A fund manager does the hard work for you and charges a small fee for it. All you need to do is select a mutual fund that matches your risk appetite.

Card_14.description: Since you plan to explore at least three countries in the next year, you are tempted to buy a loyalty card for your favorite airlines. It will give you cheaper tickets, free upgrades, and access to their lounges - all ingredients for the perfect vacation!

Card_15.description: All the gardening in your house's tiny little garden has led to a horribly cramped back. You have an ointment at home which will do perfectly fine - but you could also get an amazing massage from a professional masseuse.

Card_16.description: Since becoming a home-owner, you have developed a sudden interest in baking. The microwave oven in your kitchen is no longer cutting it. Do you open your wallet for the cutting-edge OTG baker's delight, or make do with what you have?

Card_17.description: Your Home Owner's Association has decided to levy a fee of $50 per month per car, to curb kerbside parking. Do you cough up the money to ensure safe parking, or chance it with parking on adjacent roads?
Card_17.option_2: Unsafe parking and invest $50/month for 6 months

Card_19.description: The fumes from the traffic in your congested neighbourhood have lead to a chronic cough for you. You need to get it treated from a specialist.

Card_20.description: Uh-oh. Your car needs a new radiator (already!). If you had splurged for the higher-end one, you might have received this service for free, but now it is going to have to be out-of-pocket.

Card_21.description: You have missed work twice this month already, because your car keeps breaking down. Your salary has been deducted for unauthorized leave.

Card_22.description: Your friend asks you to go along to the food truck across your office for lunch, but you prefer the sit-down ristorante nearby.

Card_23.description: Your childhood friend's baby shower is to be planned. A cheaper option is to hold it in the public garden, but you are leaning towards the country club - pricey but classy.

Card_24.description: Your phone has conked off - again - and you need to get a new one. The local store sells a basic model for cheap, which will suffice for your use. But, you've had your eye on the latest i-model out there.

Card_25.description: With all the time you've been spending at home, a home theatre sounds like a good investment.

Card_26.description: Your skin needs a particular lip balm from Paris to weather the harsh winter. Usually its available online, but this time you will have to order it from the store directly - for full price.

Card_27.description: Your neighbourhood association has organized hobby classes, and you've always fancied yourself an amateur potter.

Card_28.description: The winter has truly arrived and you need a new jacket. Your mom has offered you her old one that she's grown out of, but you've had your eye on the Chanel one in the store by your office, and it's on discount now.

Card_29.description: Yay! Your sister has just given birth and has requested you to come help her for a month in Egypt. She will pay for your flights. While you're at it, you can also explore north Africa; at your own expense, of course.

Card_30.description: A fancy car-detailing store has come up in your neighbourhood mall, and your new car could use some lighting and accents.

Card_31.description: A sudden influx of house-guests means that you need to stock up your fridge with drinks. You could make some lemonade at home, or you could get the boujee flavored waters from the store.

Card_32.description: Your country club has organized a lunch for young members, along with a fun Bingo night. You could go only for the free lunch, but you do feel lucky nowadays.

Card_33.description: A string of burglaries in your neighbourhood has made you want to invest more in security. You could buy the smart home security setups which all but arrest the miscreants, or you can depend on your cat to scare them away.

Card_34.description: Self-care is all about indulging your creativity, and you need paints for it. Sure, you have some, but they are old and dull, not shiny and glittery like the ones at the hobby store.
